conclusion: Shadows form due to the blocking of light by an object; position and size depend on positions of light source, object, and surface.
When the light source moves, the length and direction of the shadow will change.
If the light source moves backward, shadows will get shorter and move closer to the objects.
The shadows will become smaller because the angle between the light rays and the surface becomes more perpendicular.
Shadow A will shorten and move closer to the cake; the size of the shadow will decrease.
Shadow B will shorten and move closer to the sandal; the size of the shadow will decrease.
Shadow C will shorten and move closer to the feather; the size of the shadow will decrease.
Shadow D will shorten and move closer to the rectangular object; the size of the shadow will decrease.
Final Answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D will move closer to their respective objects, become shorter, and decrease in size.
